title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 13 March 2014 - XWiki
content:
<polx> has quit

04:30 <Denis> has joined #xwiki  
05:41 <evalica> has joined #xwiki  
06:01 <Denis> has quit

08:35 <msmeria> has joined #xwiki

08:38 <DarkKnightCZ> has joined #xwiki

09:11 <silverdrop> has joined #xwiki  
09:12 <woshilapin> has joined #xwiki  
09:14 <silverdrop> has quit  
09:29 <DarkKnightCZ> mflorea: you're developing the solr extension right? i want to make "similar articles" extension, i guess the best way to do that is use MoreLikeThis (vectorizing fields)... is there an api i can use from extension for direct access to solr querying?  
09:31 <mflorea> see http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/Solr+Search+Query+API  
09:31 <DarkKnightCZ> nice, thanks  
09:31 <mflorea> with $query.bindValue() you can pass Solr query parameters.  
09:32 <mflorea> if you can activate MoreLikeThis with some query parameters then it should be easy  
09:33 <DarkKnightCZ> yep, i'm running remote solr server, so it's not a problem  
09:33 <mflorea> good, any param you pass to $query.bindValue is passed directly to Solr  
09:33 <msmeria> has quit  
09:34 <DarkKnightCZ> perfect  
09:41 <lucaa> has quit  
09:43 <mflorea> has quit  
09:46 <msmeria> has joined #xwiki  
09:48 <Denis> has joined #xwiki  
10:06 <gdelhumeau> has joined #xwiki  
10:12 <polx> has joined #xwiki  
10:16 <gdelhumeau> Thanks to Denis who has published this: http://softec.lu/site/DevelopersCorner/BootstrapPrototypeConflict  
10:17 <Denis> And thanks to Marius for its original idea :)  
10:23 <lucaa> has joined #xwiki  
10:28 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
11:20 <gdelhumeau> mflorea: I am currently fixing http://ci.xwiki.org/job/xwiki-enterprise-test-escaping/lastBuild/testReport/  
11:20 <mflorea> gdelhumeau: great, thanks  
11:52 <ClemensR> has joined #xwiki  
12:07 <gdelhumeau> mflorea: in https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-enterprise/blob/master/xwiki-enterprise-test/pom.xml#L198 can I put something like "\*\*/menus/macros.vm"?  
12:13 <msmeria1> has joined #xwiki  
12:16 <msmeria> has quit  
12:32 <polx> has quit  
12:35 <sbaloul> has quit  
12:37 <sbaloul> has joined #xwiki  
12:38 <polx> has joined #xwiki

12:51 <msmeria> has joined #xwiki

12:53 <Sidali> has quit  
12:53 <mflorea> gdelhumeau: if the wildcard is supported then sure  
12:53 <gdelhumeau> is it?  
12:55 <Sidali> has joined #xwiki  
13:03 <polx> has quit  
13:03 <woshilapin> has quit  
13:05 <woshilapin> has joined #xwiki  
13:11 <mflorea> gdelhumeau: I don't know :)  
13:14 <sbaloul> Hi everyone,  
13:14 <vmassol> hi sbaloul  
13:14 <sbaloul> Please, in jira, what's the main meaning of the label "usability" ?  
13:15 <sbaloul> I'm about to close an issue, and I wonder if have to add this label or not  
13:18 <vmassol> sbaloul: for the moment we don't have a precise definition of this label  
13:18 <vmassol> actually I discussed it this morning with evalica  
13:18 <vmassol> and she's going to propose a definition for it soon enough  
13:18 <vmassol> so tu summarize, ATM there's no rule in the project that mandates using this label  
13:19 <sbaloul> Ok, so I close the issue without adding this label  
13:19 <vmassol> s/to/to  
13:19 <vmassol> yes that's ok for now  
13:19 <sbaloul> thanks  
13:19 <sbaloul> Other question please,  
13:19 <msmeria1> has joined #xwiki  
13:21 <sbaloul> I found two issues about livetable macro and adding an JavscriptExtension which is loaded by default  
13:21 <sbaloul> Can I add this issues in jira in the regarding projects  
13:22 <sbaloul> Or I have to go through mailing list  
13:22 <sbaloul> to report these two issues  
13:22 <msmeria> has quit  
13:23 <vmassol> depends if you're sure of yourself or not  
13:23 <vmassol> if not, send an email asking to confirm it's a bug  
13:24 <sbaloul> FYI I'm using 5.1 version, maybe those have already been reported or even closed  
13:24 <vmassol> then you need to test with 6.0-SNAP  
13:24 <sbaloul> ok I'm pretty sure  
13:24 <vmassol> you should always test with latest version when you develop actually  
13:24 <vmassol> it's important all apps work with latest version  
13:25 <sbaloul> Ok, I download the last verision but I've not intalled it yet  
13:25 <msmeria1> has quit  
13:29 <polx> has joined #xwiki  
13:32 <vmassol> sbaloul: FYI I've sent you some comments on github  
13:32 <sbaloul> Yes, thank you  
13:33 <sbaloul> I've already seen them :)  
13:33 <vmassol> ok cool  
13:35 <cjd> has joined #xwiki  
13:45 <polx> has quit  
13:49 <cjd> has quit  
13:49 <sbaloul> vmassol: where can I download version 6.0-SNAP ?  
13:49 <sbaloul> The last version that I found on xwiki.org is 5.4.2  
13:49 <DarkKnightCZ> is there a way how to interact with wysiwwg editor's content? i know there is api for wysiwyg and i can modify text content, but i cannot refresh it (or obtain current cursor position)  
13:58 <vmassol> has quit  
13:59 <ClemensR> sbaloul: I usually take the one directly from http://nexus.xwiki.org/nexus/content/groups/public-snapshots/org/xwiki/enterprise/xwiki-enterprise-jetty-hsqldb/  
14:00 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
14:00 <sbaloul> Thank you ClemensR :)  
14:05 <vmassol> sbaloul: on xwiki.org, check http://enterprise.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Main/Download  
14:06 <sbaloul> vmassol: ok, thank you  
14:06 <vmassol> evalica: I think we need to improve http://enterprise.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Main/Download with a TOC, most users don't see the bottom "headings"  
14:06 <vmassol> (like "other downloads" and "development builds")  
14:07 <vmassol> I'm betting that sbaloul didn't see them  
14:07 <vmassol> correct sbaloul?  
14:07 <sbaloul> vmassol: Yes, indeed  
14:08 <vmassol> actually there's a problem of styling  
14:08 <vmassol> for 5.4.2 and 5.3 the headings are larger and different than for "other downloads" and "development builds"  
14:08 <vmassol> and a toc is missing  
14:11 <ClemensR> I thought the  different headings were intentional, so the casual downloaded misses the snapshots  
14:12 <polx> has joined #xwiki  
14:15 <vmassol> it doesn't seem to work ClemensR  
14:15 <vmassol> :)  
14:15 <vmassol> sofiane was looking for it and didn't see it  
14:15 <vmassol> and I know I've had to answer this question a lot of times already in the past  
14:15 <ClemensR> well, I'd say it works too well ;)  ... never mind  
14:15 <vmassol> (question coming from java devs who were looking for it)  
14:16 <vmassol> I don't think the idea is to hide it  
14:16 <vmassol> I wouldn't see the point  
14:16 <vmassol> we do want uses to use the latest as much as possible  
14:16 <vmassol> to get early feebdack  
14:16 <vmassol> s/uses/users/  
14:17 <msmeria> has joined #xwiki  
14:30 <andreeapopescu> has quit  
14:32 <DarkKnightCZ> is there any public scripting api available for filetype -> icon matching? the same way as it is in attachments?  
14:37 <joel2> has left #xwiki  
14:37 <vmassol> DarkKnightCZ: hmm possibly, I'd need to look in the sources as I don't know ATM  
14:38 <vmassol> did you check how it was done for attachments?  
14:38 <vmassol> sbaloul: see http://dev.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Community/DevelopmentPractices#HRule:Don27tcreateunnecessaryissues  
14:38 <vmassol> actually wrong link  
14:41 <DarkKnightCZ> vmassol: nope, but i'm checking http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/Attachments+Macro right now, it looks like #mimetypeimg() is the thing i need :)  
14:41 <vmassol> sbaloul: see http://dev.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Community/DevelopmentPractices#HRule:Don27tcreateunnecessaryissues  
14:41 <vmassol> (last point)  
14:42 <sbaloul> vmassol: Ok, thanks  
14:42 <vmassol> DarkKnightCZ: yep seems you're right  
14:43 <vmassol> a script service would be nicer for the future, this is the old way of doing it through a velocity macro in macros.vm  
14:43 <vmassol> (this is a note to self)  
14:43 <vmassol> \*myself ;)  
14:44 <vmassol> some getIconNameForType() API  
14:44 <vmassol> then you'd write: [[image:icon:${services.icon.iconNameForType("my type")}]]  
14:45 <vmassol> my type == my mimetype as string  
14:45 <DarkKnightCZ> yep :) it's bad i can't use this (i need to put it in css)  
14:46 <vmassol> actually no, it's getIconNameForExtension()  
14:46 <vmassol> s/it's/it would be/  
15:09 <Sidali> has quit  
15:16 <spu7nic> has joined #xwiki  
15:26 <spu7nic> Hi there, I have a few questions concerning custom mapped classes. If I populate the generated table, how would I link those object instances to a page?  
15:27 <vmassol> spu7nic: does this help http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/DevGuide/CustomMapping ?  
15:28 <spu7nic> vmassol: I am already at this point :) - this is working so far  
15:29 <spu7nic> vmassol: The guide has a few issues, to make it work the id has to be long and the unsaved-value has to be unassigned  
15:30 <vmassol> spu7nic: please comment on the page and even better fix it :)  
15:30 <spu7nic> vmassol: Sure thing :)  
15:30 <vmassol> thanks :)  
15:30 <spu7nic> vmassol: But when I populate the table with already existing data, how can I reference this data?  
15:30 <vmassol> I haven't used custom mapping myself so I'm far from an expert, there might be others here who have used it though  
15:32 <spu7nic> I hope so :)  
15:33 <juannicolas> has joined #xwiki  
15:33 <sbaloul> You have to go through the documents (contianing the objects of the class has been mapped), and opent them and save them. you need to write a script  
15:33 <sbaloul> $xwiki.getDocument($fullName).save()  
15:34 <vmassol> isn't this step 3?  
15:34 <spu7nic> not really, it just enables the custom mapping on the class definition  
15:34 <sbaloul> no  
15:35 <vmassol> ok please add the information to the page sbaloul if you know :)  
15:35 <vmassol> hi juannicolas ;)  
15:35 <sbaloul> ok  
15:37 <juannicolas> How can i restrict users to search only in the space they allow to see by group assignation?  
15:38 <vmassol> users see only what they're allowed to see in the search  
15:40 <vmassol> DarkKnightCZ: you should use {{code language="none"}} in your comment  
15:40 <vmassol> makes it nicer ;)  
15:41 <spu7nic> vmassol: just left a comment - I was not able to edit the documentation by myself  
15:41 <spu7nic> :)  
15:41 <vmassol> oops not DarkKnightCZ  
15:41 <vmassol> I meant spu7nic ;)  
15:41 <DarkKnightCZ> vmassol: no worries :)  
15:41 <spu7nic> I will just edit the entry, thanks for the tip :)  
15:41 <vmassol> {{code …}} …{{/code}}  
15:41 <spu7nic> done :)  
15:42 <vmassol> :)  
15:42 <spu7nic> I think {{code language="xml"}} would be even better ^\_°  
15:42 <vmassol> indeed xml is even better  
15:43 <vmassol> it's "xml" not "XML", I fixed it ;)  
15:43 <vmassol> we should lowercase it by default btw, that would be a nice improvement  
15:43 <vmassol> for the code macro  
15:44 <spu7nic> ^\_°  
15:44 <vmassol> hm  
15:44 <vmassol> actually it's probably on purpose  
15:44 <vmassol> I guess pygments cares about the case  
15:45 <spu7nic> possibly  
15:45 <spu7nic> If the objects are not attached to a page, can you still query them by HQL?  
15:45 <vmassol> maybe not I don't know  
15:45 <vmassol> btw see http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/CodeMacro+Languages  
15:45 <spu7nic> thx  
15:46 <vmassol> all names look lowercase  
15:46 <vmassol> so lowercasing them automatically should work fine  
15:47 <polx> has quit  
15:47 <msmeria> has quit  
15:48 <polx> has joined #xwiki  
15:50 <juannicolas> vmassol: what I meant was, how to restrict users under no group/space rights to view to search and view documents/pages under a space? I have a user in no group, only the XWIKIAllGroup and when I do a search for a Page it did find it and can view it.  
15:51 <juannicolas> don't know If I explain it well.  
15:52 <vmassol> I don't undersand  
15:52 <vmassol> is the question:  
15:52 <vmassol> how to restrict a user from viewing pages in a given space?  
15:52 <vmassol> (pages located in a given space)  
15:52 <juannicolas> well sort of part of the question.  
15:52 <juannicolas> yes  
15:53 <vmassol> you need to set the rights of the space  
15:53 <vmassol> in the admin  
15:53 <vmassol> see http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/AdminGuide/Access+Rights  
15:54 <vmassol> actually  
15:54 <vmassol> a better doc: http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Features/RightsManagement  
15:55 <juannicolas\_> has joined #xwiki  
15:55 <juannicolas\_> vmassol: I think I got it. RIGHTS>SpaceName>XWikiAllGroup>View = Denied  
15:56 <vmassol> IMO you shouldn't use deny  
15:56 <vmassol> I never use it  
15:56 <vmassol> if you allow a user or group a given rights, it means other users/groups who don't tick that right won't have it  
15:56 <juannicolas\_> I know Denied is the upper level in permissions  
15:57 <juannicolas> has quit  
15:57 <juannicolas\_> is now known as <juannicolas>  
15:58 <msmeria> has joined #xwiki  
15:59 <juannicolas> i see  
16:00 <DarkKnightCZ> is there a way how to append custom macro to end of every page? i tried adding it to template, but since it's not global macro, it doesn't work  
16:03 <KermitTheFragger> has quit  
16:04 <KermitTheFragger> has joined #xwiki  
16:12 <ClemensR> I have not tried, but if you attach a custom version of the contentview.vm  to the XWiki.DefaultSkin is the macro known there ?  
16:12 <juannicolas> is now known as <jndlc>  
16:14 <vmassol> every page, or every page that has a given xobject attached to it?  
16:15 <polx> has quit  
16:15 <DarkKnightCZ> every page  
16:15 <vmassol> if every page then it means even the default pages like Main.AllDocs, etc  
16:15 <polx> has joined #xwiki  
16:15 <vmassol> are you sure this is not something that should part of your skin instead?  
16:15 <spu7nic> Hmmm, seems I received editing permissions :) - I think I can delete my comment  
16:15 <vmassol> if it's on every page, it's skin for me :)  
16:16 <DarkKnightCZ> vmassol: yep, it should be skin  
16:17 <vmassol> DarkKnightCZ: there are some docs that explain how to create a custom skin. As ClemensR said, overriding contentview.vm for ex would work  
16:17 <DarkKnightCZ> ok then, gonna try find it  
16:19 <sbaloul> I think, it'd better add it in the Footer (skin)  
16:21 <sbaloul> you should copy footer.vm into Footer (skin) and change it  
16:23 <vmassol> it really depends where he wishes to add content  
16:23 <sbaloul> he said "to end of every page"  
16:24 <DarkKnightCZ> yep, i meant under page content... but still, i cannot use macros defined as xobject, so i guess it has to be done in another way (global macro i guess)  
16:25 <vmassol> if you use footer.vm then it's going to be after extra docs tab  
16:25 <vmassol> indeed you cannot use xwiki syntax in a vm  
16:25 <vmassol> (at the moment)  
16:25 <vmassol> well there's a way but it's hacky ;)  
16:26 <vmassol> (using the rendering script service)  
16:26 <vmassol> it's a good problem you're asking here :)  
16:26 <vmassol> what you can do is use this:  
16:27 <vmassol> use the #include macro  
16:27 <vmassol> #includeInContext for example  
16:27 <vmassol> to call a page  
16:27 <vmassol> and put your content in that page  
16:27 <vmassol> http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/Include+In+Context+Macro  
16:32 <DarkKnightCZ> yep, thanks... but i still think i'm gonna rewrite that to global macro  
16:34 <polx> has quit  
16:37 <vmassol> I have no clue what you mean :)  
16:37 <vmassol> velocimacro?  
16:37 <vmassol> (in macros.vm)  
16:37 <DarkKnightCZ> yep  
16:37 <vmassol> you'll still need to call that include if you want wiki syntax  
16:39 <DarkKnightCZ> it's "related topics" macro -> calls solr and fetches related pages to currently open one (uses only html)  
16:41 <vmassol> ok, just know that you can put all the code in wiki page if you wish using #includeXXX  
16:42 <DarkKnightCZ> yep, going to rethink that tomorrow  
16:44 <ClemensR> I just wonder if loading them via ajax after page load is an option, too  
16:45 <DarkKnightCZ> i guess it is... passing necessary data as ajax param, thanks  
16:46 <DarkKnightCZ> has quit

17:46 <vmassol> cool mflorea :)  
17:49 <mflorea> we'll see on xwiki.org if it improves anything. Hard to tell with the default distribution.  
17:49 <vmassol> mflorea: we can easily get a clone of xwiki.org to test it  
17:49 <vmassol> I'd prefer it to be tested before the upgrade time  
17:49 <vmassol> as otherwise it's too late if it doesn't work :)  
17:52 <polx> has quit  
17:52 <vmassol> yeah time is a scarce resource these days ;)  
17:53 <mflorea> yep :(
